As of writing I have about 150 hours in this game and while Im a massive MK fanboy i just cant recommend this broken mess. It runs like sludge ,  its half baked , its $70 , two of its dlc characters are certainly base roster cuts, it takes up 100 gigs and when it crashes (and it does so often) it saves crash reports that take up around 1.5 gb each. If youre not carefull and clear these out , this will easily brick up your pc. 
This game is coded so poorly it might as well be malwere. I remember Cyberpunk 2077 running better on my first plathrough(on release) on an old PC with a Ryzen 5 and GTX 1060 combo then this game runs now on my current 12 gen i7 GTX3060 combo.

- The gameplay is good though.
Not my favourite mk ever but its pretty cool.
The visuals are best we ever had as well and while some of the character designs are not my favourite thats hardly a knock on the visual fidelity of the game.
Its a big step up from 11 and 11 was already a visually stunning game.
Sadly unlike 11 it really is surface level.
Once you bite into it youlll realize that it left you craving more and asking yourself where did the rest of it go.
There are NO cosmetics to unlock. Most of the cool cosmetics are premium shop. 
I repeat this $70 game is selling cometics as if its fortnite or apex legends. One skin? yeah , gimme $10 . One annnouncer voice? Also $10.  Base mk11 i could play for months before i unlocked all the stuff but here I literally got a message from the game that I unlocked everything in the shrine and to come back next patch. Like ARE you kidding me!? Thank god we have 5 PREMIUM currency exclusive skins though. There are only 4-5 skins you can unlock in the game (bar the color swaps for each characters base skin and alternate costume)  
They are 
Yakuza Kenshi
Indiana Jones Johnny Cage
Evil Sindel and Geras
Scorpion gets a unique kombat league skin this season too.
In the premium shop we get
2 color set variants of dia de los muertos sub zero
1 dia de los muertos scorpion
Kanibal Mileena 
MKDeception Scorpion
Brazil Tanya 
And it gets even worse for kameos as they have NO skins in either the shrine OR the premium shop.
The ONLY skin for your kameo is Sonyas MK3 skin and honestly its just a flat out upgrade to her MK1 design so it might as well be her default because her default is ugly as sin.
The online is also the worst its been since MKX got outfitted with rollback. The game often runs like sludge online.  Im genuenly shocked at how bad this game is. There is a really good game here but its being absolutely run into the ground with corporate greed and what i can only assume is a rushed development. I bet we had injustice 3 in the making but was scrapped in the change in menagement from WB after the aquisition. So while some people tought this game was the one that took longest to develop (skipping injustice 3) it might be the opposite. The super hero DLC roster might be salvaged character designs from said injustice 3 . 
Overall whats on display here is good. Really good but its what isnt here that makes this sting so much.
So much is missing and even the good parts dont work often as the game is just poorly coded with lots of bugs , crashes and gameplay sttuter. 
Wait for a sale. While we wait for discounts they will hopefully fix the game and add actual content to it.
They really need to pull a cyberpunk comeback or at least mount a sf5 level glowup.

Game has been clearly rushed, feature comparison with MK11 leaves this one looking quite anemic, with not as much personal customization of kombatants. The invasion mode is fun but is drawn out with a bunch of bloat mechanics that slow down progression through it. The main bad of guy of this (Shang Tsung) is locked behind an 8 dollar paywall if you didn't preorder as well. Not a big fan of the Kameo system either but that's more down to personal preference. Overall I think this is just a much lesser game than it's predecessor and clearly needed another year or two in the oven before release, makes me think WB wanted to bank on the good will MK11 and Aftermath instilled to make a quick buck, and I feel the 40$ kombat pack 1 reinforces that idea.

Easily some of the most fun I've had playing a MK game in recent memory. As far as gameplay goes, MK1 beats the dogshit out of MK11 in regards to fun factor. The only real issue I have is that this game is seemingly bereft of single player content. Story mode is great as usual and Invasions is okay, but there's little else to do currently other than grind rank in Kombat League. This along with the plethora of bugs at launch is a clear sign that this game was rushed out the door by WB. However, these things can be improved easily with a couple of patches, gameplay cannot. So for the MK enthusiasts and fighting game enjoyers in general, I recommend MK1 wholeheartedly!

Game was obviously released prior to it being finished, more than a month later:

Frame Data is still incorrect in menu

Cross region play is awful and has server side issues

Load times are awful

Infinite with Sindel has been out for weeks, no fix

The shrine is literally the only thing "Koins" are used for so they can force monthly live-service seasons currency for absolutely no reason

and, I'm sure there's some I missed.

The game is fine for a fighting game, one of the best looking MK games I've ever played, but the issues above absolutely cause issues and annoyance while playing. 

Would I recommend this to a friend? No. I'd suggest they wait until the game is finished and on sale.

Easily the best of the Netherrealm Mortal Kombat games. The story has had some massive upgrades in writing and it shows. The new direction and redesign of the world and characters is a very welcome breath of fresh air in this old franchise. The sound direction is also superb.

A word on performance: it's fine. A lot of people on here seem to either not have the right equipment for a modern game (been seeing this with a lot of releases this year. It's not the developers fault you don't have a strong enough computer) or are upset that they can't run the game on the highest settings. Even on mid-range settings, this game is absolutely gorgeous. While some patches are very much needed, I'm not going to judge a game based on what will almost certainly be fixed in the near future (and isn't really that bad in the first place).

There is a lot to do here and while there is a cash shop, it's not really that big a deal. Spend some money or don't, it's really not required or pushed in your face.

The worst thing about this game is Megan Fox's absolutely sub-par voice acting. I mean it's super noticeable. After hearing hours of quality professional voice acting, Nitara sounds noticeably amateur. I really hope they replace her with someone. Or even AI (it would still be an improvement).

Played the early access, finished the campaign and am still finishing season 1 of the invasion mode.

The story is imo the best of the franchise. It feels good to see actual character development, or characters with actual morals and personalities, whether good or bad. Spoiler: [spoiler]It got a bit chaotic after the twist into the end, and i was kind of hoping for a more laidback story that was more about the new era and not a multiverse scenario, but it was still enjoyable[/spoiler] Gameplay is very good, and seeing how all the characters work makes me want to learn all of them, something that lacked in the previous title, MK11. Invasion mode is... meh. I love the idea of a cool environment with a boardgame-like playstyle, but it does get a bit tedious after a while. Fights dont feel rewarding (aside from xp) until after you've beaten the final bosses and completed a mesa, and even then I still wonder what exactly I earned. As well, the choice of towers included is a bit ironic, considering Invasion was supposed to be an alternative to Towers of Time from MK11. Secret fights are also a bit dumb. Invasion already includes ambushes, which are surprise fights that can occur at any time as you traverse the mesas. Secret fights add nothing but drag on the tower fights, with no actual rewards to make it worth it. Invasion mode is a bit messy, but the idea is there and has a lot of potential. I haven't played ranked yet but I can't wait to get my ass handed to me lol.

Overall, I am definitely enjoying the game, but I feel like with the Invasion mode in order to keep me more invested in the single player aspect of the game, there needs to be some work done. The gameplay is phenomenal, and the story is a lot of fun with major improvements to characters and plot compared to X and 11. I dont think $70 is a very fun price, let alone $110, so if you arent a super Mortal Kombat fan, maybe consider waiting for a small discount or consider steam keys.

I want to start off by saying I'm a lifelong Mortal Kombat fan. I own every single game except Special Forces, and several of the games I DO own, I have on multiple platforms.

I regret to declare this game is extremely disappointing. It has been over a month since release, and for many ps5 and PC players, in offline multiplayer, player 2 cannot perform ANY fatalities or use unlocked skins. This is absolutely unacceptable for a MK game, which in no small part is designed to be played at parties and other social events with your buddies.

The story for this game, while mostly great in the first half, and refreshing for giving unlikely characters a story chapter, is so poorly written in the second half it puts anyone's concens about MK11's story to shame. By the end, this is easily the worst story mode for a MK game, trading any narrative value, conflict stakes, or character depth merely to show off a variety of skins. If you come to MK for the story, watch it on youtube. Don't waste your money on this.

Invasions mode is also pretty disappointing when you consider what it is. You move from square to square to fight an enemy under certain conditions while reading text boxes and listening to narration. MKX's Krypt, and MK11's Krypt, and even MK9's challenge towers were all significantly more fun to play through than this.

Finally, this might be just a me thing, but I'm unhappy with the kameo system. Unless you're a high level player who is good at juggling and stringing together long combos, the kameos aren't very fun to use, and ultimately strike me as a low effort attempt for NRS to put more characters in the game without having to go to the trouble of actually making them playable (you'd expect them to be, when the game is 100GB of memory despite it being exclusively a 2.5D fighting game).

In conclusion I cannot recommend this game to anyone. I've been putting off this review while waiting for the game to be patched with a solution for the offline multiplayer problem, but I payed $90 for this game and a month later it's still unusable at any social gathering. This is not ok.

The PC port of this game is very bad. Long loading times, unoptimized, and full of bugs. I suggest getting a console version of the game because of all the issues. I'm very disappointed in all the bugs overall. Kameos not doing their attack, bad connectivity without the ability to deny a match, and if your opponent has this game installed on an HDD you are boned.

Furthermore the metagame is relatively stale right now: lots of Cyrax with the top 3 characters. The issue isn't there are top tier strategies...the issue is there is _one top tier strategy for each character_. Reiko/Darrius, Raiden/Jax, Johnny/Cyrax, Kung Lao/Goro...And during a set you can't change fighters which causes the issue where you can be stuck in a bad matchup!

I'm hoping this game will get fixes and works better but honestly I'm not certain it will happen. 

In Summation: Fun game but metagame has gotten stale very quickly and the PC port is badly optimized. Hoping for improvements but if you're a huge MK fan and MUST play this game...get a console copy.

Great game, great series. Looks amazing and feels amazing to play (most of the time). I've had a ton of fun with story mode, online, and even just practice mode testing out all the fun combos I can do. The game has a lot of life to it, and I would typically recommend it to anyone who's a fan of the series, or just a fun of fighting games in general. Loads of fun.

There are some negatives though. It's worth noting this was initially a negative review because the game launched with some game-breaking bugs, but they were patched pretty fast which I appreciate. The game still has a few bugs of course, and there's occasional issues with online mode (disconnects and such), but most of the time playing online feels good. Balance wise, the game is in a decent state with some things to be desired. At the time of writing, Sindel has an infinite (though I imagine this will be fixed, as its more of a bug) and there are some characters that feel much stronger when compared to others (Raiden, Johnny Cage, Kenshi, Baraka) but hopefully they'll balance them when the time comes.

Oh it's also worth noting that this game's monetization, while not nearly as bad as some other games currently out, is bad. Kombat Pack 1 / 2 costing 40 bucks plus the game costing 70, along with the fact that Shang Tsung is a pre-order bonus is really, really a lot of money. Just buying all characters alone, you'd be paying $155 presuming you didn't preorder Shang Tsung. I am very excited for the content we're getting for these packs though. 

Overall, would suggest getting into this game. Mortal Kombat 1 is awesome!

Since no one likes to listen to my opinion, ill just cut to the chase:

- Story mode is 9 hours long, and invasions are also 9 hours long
- Story made is great, Megan Fox is not
- Invasion mode is basically a bunch of repeated fights in a mario party board
- Game runs at 60 FPS MAX (I assume for fighting game reasons)
- Menus, Fatalities, In-Game cutscenes, and invasion board all are locked at 30fps and stutters alot
- Fatality distance is written incorrectly (close is actually mid, mid is actually long, long is actually longer)
- Season 1 invasion cosmetics for all characters look like garbage
- Story mode is great tho
- Either multiplayer is full of lagswitchers or the games are generally super laggy online
- Game is not polished (no starting character interactions, some character models would float in the air during brutalities)
- The company has not made any patches or feedback to the kommunity in this game since its early release in September
- Every time your game crashes, the game creates a crash report that consumes 1GB of storage
- Kombat pack is a DLC "season pass" without telling you its a season pass, which is deceptive marketing

SIDENOTE: Alot of people on Windows have reported having numerous crashes and bugs in the game. I play on Linux with an AMD graphics and CPU system, and i have not had a single crash or bug playing this game. Your experience with the games performance might vary wildly at this point. 

Game isn't worth $70; Isn't even worth $40. The general lack of polish and care for this game makes it maybe worth $15 dollars at this point. I don't play fighting games that much, but this pretty much soured my taste in them for awhile. I'm going back to play injustice 2 or something.

This game crashes during the tower load screen constantly.

Would you recommend this game to others? I'd say "no" because it kicks me in the groin every time the whole game aspect comes up. It's 100x closer to being a game compared to its contemporaries -- which would be more charitably described as "tournament apps" -- but compared to previous Netherrealm titles like MK11 or Injustice 2 it's like whoever's job it was to come up with gameplay ideas took a loooooooong vacation during development and no one dared pick up the slack. 

MK12 (let's face it that's the more appropriate title) feels like it was half-assed in every category that wasn't online multiplayer focused. For example the character banter at the loading screen into the fights in Versus Mode is one of the most creative ideas in recent history... but if you're not playing strictly in versus and, say, doing the exact same dueling to the death in one of the handful of other gameplay modes that feature is not only absent but you get to stare at a blank screen. I feel sorry for the voice actors and writers who spent so much work just to have a blank screen for 90% of the times where it would be applicable. 

No Krypt mode either. Instead there's invasion mode, which is a neat idea on paper but again half-assed since you could re-create the entire experience in RPG Maker from 10 years ago. 

Three cheers to Netherrealm for not engaging in loot boxes, pay-extra progression, and other signs of villainy... but again what the game does have to reward you with is largely half-assed (I think I'm seeing a pattern here). They run out of ideas so quickly that your reward for getting a given cameo to level five is an insulting handful of easy fatality tokens, instead of a costume, color scheme, etc that would add some flavor to gameplay. 

All that said and the story I'm in two minds about. On one hand it's the best story in fighting games released in 2023, but compared to their competition it would be like winning an arm wrestling match against a man with no arms. And there's a certain lack of effort I'm endeavoring to try to stop banging on about, but it is really disappointing because the first half of the story was a 10/10 experience. Then a lever gets flipped at the halfway mark and the masterful story writer gets tagged out for a four-year old downing pixie sticks hand over fist and all attempts at world-building are swiftly brutalized. It would have been less insulting to cut to black halfway thru, write "one thing lead to another" in plain Arial font on the screen, then cut to credits. 

And whoever's job it was to balance the gameplay experience fell ill, died, etc during development because frankly its atrocious. I play thru a character's tower mode on the highest difficulty, conclude the fight with a brutality to get the highest earnings, and am rewarded with 175 XP. Meanwhile I could go into invasion mode, bully a level 1 mission with my max level character with a single uppercut, and get 300 XP. 

The two clearly positive things I can say about this are:
   1) The combo system is straightforward and very satisfying. 
   2) Every character on the roster is worthy of your attention, from looks to combat feel

If that's enough for you, great. If not, leave this game to rot in the flesh pits of online tournaments (because clearly that was the only bit of this that had development's full attention). Pick up MKX or MK11 instead if you want an actual "game" in the fighting genre.

Never played a MK game until MK1, I really enjoy it. I've always known about the series but never actually played it. Seeing some of the characters get changed the way they did like Barakka and such, was amazing. I really enjoyed them as a character, I enjoy how doing the towers is how you see how alot of these threads get capped off. The biggest strength of MK1, is its clean looking. Runs absolutely fantastic! And theres plenty of content, if your just a PVE player.

Lets break it down though:

Story Mode: I loved the story mode, the story was really fun, really engaging, and constantly wanting you to know whats going to happen next. Its a simple story, but its a fun story. I also enjoy how all these people had new origins. The ending was amazing, loved fighting the mix up fighters. Downside about it, its a one and done kinda deal sadly. Theres no reason to ever touch it again. Wish there was more achievements locked to it or some reason to go back.

Invasions: What can I say about invasions? They are incredibly fun, but very repetitious. I really wish they used the mix up fighters from the end of the story mode, in invasions and hope they do something like that in future seasons. Season 1 invasion took me afew days to complete, I unlocked all the seasonal gear. You'll get plenty of currency and all in all, its fun if your looking for just a single player experience. You then have the gateway nexus where you get all sorts of towers be it daily, weekly, hourly, seasonal. And absolutely none of them are worth it, from my experience. 

Towers: Towers are so much fun to do, only for the ending. Outside of that, its very formulaic. But the endings are completely worth it to get.

Shrine: Holy smokes, this is the games lootbox system. Its fine, its fun if your trying to complete the Kollection and to my knowledge, the only way to get the concept art and what not. But the fact I can only spend 1000 koins, have to then wait 30 seconds, before going through another cutscene. This is a simple fix and more of a QoL problem, then a mechanical one.

Tutorials/Practice: I'm not sure if ANY other MK games have this, but its a god send. I love practice mode, I love the tutorials, because you can focus on learning each of your fighters kombos.

Fighters: I love the initial list. Because each one of the fighters truely feels unique in their own way and each fighter feels like they have their extreme strengths and weaknesses. I played around 20 hours of Liu Kang, absolutely loved playing him. Then switched to trying to find a secondary character and found I struggled because you get so used to movements and strengths. I was expecting each fighter to be essentially just a reskin, nope. Geras plays completely differently than Liu Kang does. The only downside, is that the game is not super balanced, there are some fighters who just got luckier in development than others. And the MK1 Kombat Pack 1 being available but none of the content released at launch is a huge negative. Shang Tsung and Quan Chi, who are BOTH in the base game, ALREADY as fighters, you have to play against and you have to pay for them, is a joke.

Kameo: Oh boy, this one has been a wild ride. Some Kameos are absolutely useful as hell. Then you get some Kameos who are just useless. The idea behind the Kameo system is absolutely amazing and I really hope for MK2 or in MK1 updates, we get some updates on it. But as of right now, pick Sareena and just rolfmao.

Kombat Leagues: Oh boy. its just best of 5. Tier 1 - 3, you can't lose any ranking. So, just spam your games out to get the seasonal rewards to hit Tier 4.

Warrior Shrine: Still locked, can't review anything.

All in all, I have 42 hours on MK1. I absolutely love the game and can't wait to keep sinking more hours in. At this time, i've hit Tier 4 in Kombat League, finished all the invasion kontent, did all the towers and am sitting at about 35% kompleteion rate of the kollection.

Can't recommend it enough if your new to the series and hopefully will have the same kinda experience i've had with the game. Can't wait to log another 40 hours.

Mortal Kombat 1 is a respectable sequel to the NRS MK Saga. I've played a lot of MK9 on PS Vita and a little bit of MK11 on Steam.  Without much experiance, MK1 was easy to pick up, but offering a good amount of depth. The roster is nice, including fan-favourites as well as some obscure characters, who all feel unique. I especially like the gameplay, kameo system and visual style. Unfortunately, the story mode disappointed me. It felt fresh at the beginning but after 3/4 mark it started to be way too weird and messy for my liking. I had fun nontheless. The game itself also lacks some key features like pinning moves in training mode, match lobbies, changing skin in character select etc. - mostly quality of life stuff. What I dislake is Invasions mode. It's boring, repetitive, and even with a lot of rewards hidden there I prefer top play online and get skins amd gear from the Shrine. Mortal Kombat 1 also has some technical issues. Even though my PC should handle the game well and for most of the time I can play i twith very hight graphic settings with little o no bad effect on performance, the game crashed many times. It happend more in the first day after the realease, now it seems to be fixed but still sometimes happens. In conclusion it's a very fun and exciting game, that simply needs more polish. I recommend it.

Oh man, I feel so bad but I have to do this.
Just a disclaimer, I can't say I did not have fun in this game because I for sure did. It is a good time but the cracks will start showing and will only deepen until you will realize this game has had mixed focus on its features but its replayability is lacking in many ways I will get into.

I am a huge MK fan but I joined late in about 2013. My favorite to this day is MKX and still holds best and coolest combos. This MK1 introduces many ways to build combos which is quite awesome but sometimes these feel so drawn out and similar to MK11's gravity. Kameos are a great addition but is it really something new? I swear we had something similar in MK11 towers where we could use some character's help every now and then. Kameos bring new ways to play BUT they take fighters away. The kameos will almost never talk meaning they can put anyone in the role but I for one I am annoyed many of them are JUST kameo fighters and not normal fighters, with unique voicelines and more moves. As a Jax main, I miss punching the hell out of the opponents but I can only resort to some combo extenders foir others...

Story is entertaining but it gets messy until its very end, just like MK11 but with more weird shit. It is cool seeing all these returning characters, however I wish for some characters they had kept same voice actors. It is also inexcusable to have story characters as DLC...like Ermac & Quan Chi. Waiting for them will be pain...

Invasions mode is such a weird RPG board game kinda thing that takes centuries to progress and its fights become annoying as hell with unblockable, uninterruptible characters & random effects that just makes you mad. You can tone the fuckery down with the syringes & upgrading your character as you level up.

And one of my main points is the replayability: once you've gone through invasions & story you will realize you have such meaningless and similar looking gear & pallettes to choose from...these feel so lazy and barely noticeable sometimes. Very few are creative and cool but guess what...most of those are PAID SKINS! Skins that may cost even 10$??? In an already 100$ game? This is beyond greedy. Grinding this game is barely worth the hassle for now, they gotta do better.

And for the really ugly: unfinished stuff. The story sometimes has insane lag & desync from subtitles, fades to black randomly despite me doing the shaders precompilation...Oh my god the menus take FOREVER...moving in invasions as well...I can't skip anything before & after a fight...just WHY?? Especially in singleplayer...Also training doesnt let me pin any moves, there is no crossplay, the brutalities have sometimes weird inputs to them but not as bad as MK11's. The character intros could have used 3 lines instead of 2 and make them less boring. There are no friendships(yet), but we got kameo fatalities which are cool I guess.

There are so many more I'd like to point out but it's already getting long enough. Do I recommend this game? To a degree and a certain price drop, yes....but for 70 bucks I will definitely not. The game can be fun but has many many issues that could be fixed in time and IF they actually make the game better, I will then recommend the game and change my review. But for now, this game feels so much like early access & knowing some characters will NEVER be main characters, but just kameos kinda hurts, man. My man Tremor did not deserve that, as well as Jax, Sonya & Kano and all the others honestly. The gameplay can be quite awesome and addicting but your rewards are usually so meaningless and not much different. Hope they make better ones really...
Even though it is still missing some basic fighting game feature, especially online. The base game feels great, looks and sounds amazing. Looking forward to the future.

This is a bad game!

I love Mortal Kombat so I've been playing it a lot but this is THE buggiest piece of garbage I've ever seen. It needs sorting out, I know that's not gonna happen though because they don't care, they proved that when they abandoned MK11.

Bugs I've seen:
1. Reptile in his reptile form at the end of matches when the Main roster character and the Kameo pose for the victory screen, his lips jiggle around
2. Random props jiggling around on brutality screens like Shao's axe
3. At the end of a classic tower you see Shang and Quan Chi being knocked into a hole, then your two characters stand and pose at the top, I used Cyrax one time and his Saw was floating in front of him
4. I played a tower in invasions in the gateway bit and I lost against Mileena, but the continue button didn't show up for like 30-45 seconds because she was doing a very slow motion teleport animation and she disappeared until it was just her hair left glowing pink
5. The things on the ground to let you know which towers you're going to in the gateway area are wrong, i.e., the weekly, daily and hourly things are labelled wrong
6. A handful of things in the menus are wrong like brutality requirements or how many bars of meter certain moves cost (this is fucking basic shit, get it fixed, its disgusting that the previous games have this polish and this game for some reason is exempt)
7. Mileena's amplified (ground) ball roll sometimes misses, she makes contact with the opponent but when she slams the sais into what is supposed to be the opponents feet she does it the wrong way and you've wasted a bar of meter

I can honestly say that I haven't witnessed any bugs in MKX or 11. This is a massive step back, the company and devs should be completely ashamed of what they've released. Its an incomplete mess. There are things in the menus that are greyed out and unavailable. They've taken out features of previous games like rooms. What the actual fuck is going on?

What were they thinking with the gateway towers? Why do your combos get interrupted every few seconds, is that supposed to be fun? Its not, but was that the intent?

I KNOW this is going to fall on deaf ears though. I will actually be surprised if they fix this stuff.

I originally wrote a review where I recommended the game despite its flaws but more flaws keep cropping up and its beyond a joke. That's not even taking into account how PC players get screwed over by poor optimisation.

TL;DR if you're someone who is looking at this as your first fighting game or first Mortal Kombat game, I promise you its not worth it right now. Get MKX or 11 instead.

Edit: I found another bug, I play as Mileena a lot so if I'm finding this many bugs on one character there must be tons that I'm not seeing - I used the amplified (air) ball roll in an online match and the sound effect lasted until both rounds had been completed.

I'm also gonna consider the following a bug:
Some attacks whiff on against Baraka which seems COMPLETELY RIDICULOUS considering how easy it is for him to deal 50% damage. I do Mileena's 1,2 attack and the third hit misses and boom he's done 50% damage. Its shit.

Story and offline modes are fun except for the crashing. An incredible amount of unfinished sections of the game with game breaking bugs and glitches. 

Tons of oversight like they never had anyone playtest the game at all, for example: 
mileena ex low sai requires you have 2 meter even tho it only costs 1, 
her ex air special randomly doesn't cost meter and can be spammed rapidly, 
Nitara hover randomly takes meter even though its a meterless move, 
etc...  

Every crash dumps a 1gb+ crash report into your appdata folder to clutter up your computer. 
Online is horrible and crashes even more than offline. 
Tons of brutalities have badly coded requirements that aren't stated and or also glitch out horribly like they didn't even bother to finish coding it, the movelist menu is broken, frame data is wrong, dialogue shows up as mk12_dialogue_4532, sometimes a characters name or a menu title shows up as tweakVar. 
Actually playing against another player feels like all the worst parts of mk11 with slower strings that make combos last longer in a painfully boring way.

A good game held back by some flaws needing urgent help and a plot that fails to actually reboot.

The Pro's:

- Invasion Mode has flaws but overall I enjoyed the leveling process and playing to unlock the Scorpion Skin. The game needs more singleplayer modes like this.
- There is actually some decent single player content in it, which will be seasonal.
- The Kameo system, the ease of fatalities and the overall system is pretty good.
- Despite some problems the first half of the story mode is pretty good. (i saw it already online, i'm currently not fully through it yet but I know where it leads)

Contra's:

- The monetisation is quite something...
- There is much less customisation.
- Invasion has too many cases of armor or where you and the oppponent suffer every 2 or so seconds from suffocation, stunning/interrupting the characters.
- Needs far more single player content.
- Bi Han (the original Sub Zero) and Shao Kahn start with promise and end up ruined quickly. 
- The storyline is a reboot for the first 3/4s and then jumps the shark again with multivere nonsense. And even from the start there are things tying it into the previous games. A full reboot would have been better with a more restrained scope and better writing. For example: do the original MK 1 Earthreal and MK2 Outworld Tournaments. Then end there. In future games then move on to things like Shinnok or the Deadly Alliance.


Conclusion:

Good basis.
Fun for fans of the franchise.
For a newcomer i recommend waiting for a discount and some more patches.
ESPECIALLY if unlike me you're big on competitive play, online play is apparently in need of some patching.

I went into this game expecting to hate it, given the weird lore changes I heard about and the iffy voice acting and ESPECIALLY the weird monetisation, but, surprisingly, everything about it has hit for me! 

The gameplay feels, so god damn good, the animations are tight and responsive, not stiff like NRS games have been for years, I especially love the solid hits and simple brutality of my main man Reiko.

The game looks beautiful even on the low graphics that I am running it on, and despite warnings of bad optimisation, I have found the game to be pretty stable, save for a few rare crashes, so personally performance is pretty good for me but I can't speak for everyone, my computer is a weird frankenstein's monster that cannot run fortnite, elder scrolls online or GTA V; but can run shit like WH40k Darktide and, well, this game.

The most shocking bit is just how good the music is? Like it genuinely gets me hyped up during matches, NRS games have had such awful music for YEARS just the most forgettable dreck imaginable, but this time around they got a few stand out bangers, the final round of Living Forest being my absolute favorite

The story, is, admittedly, kinda "so bad it's good" for most of it's run time, does fall into a few annoying cliches that MCU movies find them in (I fucking hate the MCU), but I tried my best to go into it with an open mind and found that the characters are surprisingly well written across the board, save for a few. And, without spoiling anything, the story does end up going in a direction I did not expect, and I love it! I genuinely enjoyed the last, quarter of the story I'd say, though, that last super interesting quarter felt waaaaay too short, I am VERY much looking forward to the upcoming story expansion, I have an open mind to whatever wacky bullshit they wanna pull!

The monetisation is still complete hogwash though, please stop charging for cosmetics in a game that costs 100 canadian dollars for the standard edition, I just wanna dress up my hot roman man. I say this knowing full well Reiko is not gonna get any cool cosmetics ever lmfao

The story given feels exciting and makes sense but the plot is a bit fast, I think the part where Shang Tsung and Liu Kang gather an alliance to prepare for Armageddon is interesting to be shown, but everything feels complete with character building. NetherRealm have said that they plan on supporting MK1 for a while, possibly as long as MK11, so we will wait and see whether the game improves with balance changes and bug fixes.

Game has great foundation and structure--but like many games now it has it's share of issues at launch. Frequent crashing is my biggest problem with it, in the middle of an online set it crashes and the match is lost. Customization is locked behind heavy grind systems (although it seems like they will keep expanding on this), lots of black screens while playing online, no way to tag combos in practice. The kameo system is amazing. Invasions is a great idea, but executed a little bland. If you want to have fun skip the story and invasions-head over to practice and pick a character up-then go online. All in all it's a great game but i would wait to buy it until a couple patches are made and things like frequent crashing are fixed.

I have about 24 hours at the time of creating this review which isn't a lot. However I feel as if there is some things to be said about this game. First and foremost, this game is poorly optimized. I don't have the greatest computer, so if I was the only person experiencing lag and the similar, then i would keep my opinions to myself. But watching any youtube video, even from players with some beefy computers it's still quite laggy and it often struggles. The game has some absolutely stunning graphics, but I fear that this came at the cost of limited fps, quick fatalities that don't encompass the feeling of a fatal ending, and a weak boss that is just a dlc character. I do believe that this game isn't quite as good as mk11, mainly because the performance issues. However I do still recommend the game. It has a mechanic that no other mortal kombat game does (kameos), and it has new fun aerial kombos that also aren't in other mortal kombat games.

This game is bad.

Gameplay: It just boils down to "do the same 20 second long 30% combo three times each match" and jailing.  I think that kameos are a big culprit in why this is the case with the combos.  Jailing is a REALLY bad concept (, and it's what this game is.  Without jailing, there is no MK1.  So, if jailing is bad and this game is centered around jailing, this game is bad.

Ranked: Structured terribly.  No placement matches means everyone starts at the lowest rank.  This becomes problematic when you reach a higher rank and get matched up against a very good player who just started ranked.  When you win, you gain points (obviously).  When you win against someone who is a lower rank than you, you gain less points and lose more.  So, I could be matched up against someone who is better than me but is the lowest rank, giving me a possible point gain of like 3 but a possible point loss of like 50.
	Rank is account-based, not character-based.  So, if I play any other character than my main, I will get stomped on.
	Sets are best of 5 instead of best of 3, which is dumb.  It means that a player has to sit through up to 5 matches to gain <10% of a rank.  Also you can only quit early if you lose the round, so if you beat someone who camped the whole time you might have to sit through it again.
	
Invasions: Just boring.  Play against some enemy, do a combo twice, beat the enemy, move on.  Sometimes you have to button-mash too.  Zzzzzzzzzz

Story: Good story-wise, ok gameplay-wise, but bad experience-wise.  If you are at a fight and decide to exit the game, it will save your progress, but when you go to continue it puts you back at the start of the cutscene before the fight.  This wouldn't be an issue because you can skip cutscenes, but you can't actually skip the cutscene until about a minute has passed.  Why?  Also, if you fail a fight you have to watch/listen to a small wind-up dialogue for about 7 seconds.  Why?  I just want to try again, I don't want to hear the same thing 20 times.  Also, there is no clear indication of the next roung starting each fight.  This makes it so you can't act as fast as your opponent, giving them an advantage.  I don't get why they didn't just have it say "fight" like it does online.

Misc:
 - Nitara voice acting
 - Crouch block into stand block just doesn't work.  I never let go of the block button, let go of the stick, SEE MY CHARACTER START TO STAND, and still get hit by an overhead.  People other than me have also encountered this, and it is very stupid that you get punished for doing the right thing
 - Some maps make it hard to see what is happening, which could be solved by allowing for client-side map picking.  It wouldn't affect anything because the stage doesn't add anything to the fight like it did in MK11.
 - Throw escape is inconsistent.  I do it right most of the time (maybe not the right direction but it should still say escape failed) but it doesn't work.  Also if you are mid grab wind-up your opponent can still grab you, in which case there SHOULD be a mutual throw escape like in every other video game.
 - Matches take way too long to load into, which is a pretty major downside
 - Seasonal cosmetics (I personally don't like the idea of timed collectibles, but I know most people are probably fine with them).
 - Fatal blows are half kameo half player, when it really should be all player.

Not recommended.
The game is out for a month and the PC port is still plagued by disconnects, desynchronization, horrible connections and absolutely horrible balance.

- The game has no way to create a lobby with your friends, it only supports 1 v1 and those connections drop frequently
- King of the Hill doesn't work for invites, the lobby only works for the first invitee to accept and the other people are shut out
- Online games frequently desynchronize where you cannot get into a ranked match or Kasual Match
- No way to filter on connection type or quality and no way to back out unless the ping is more than 150
- Characters and kameos are not even close to balanced: Ranked consists almost exclusively of Barakka/Cyra, Johny/Cyrax and one or two others but guess what the Kameo is? Yep, Cyrax.

Gameplay-wise I would not recommend it, but those issues can get fixed with balance patches.
The fact that NRS and it's partner that made the port felt comfortable releasing a 60-70 euro title in this state, with a massive lack of features and an overall downgrade of MK11, tells you all you need to now: carefully consider if you want to spend money on this game.

I'm going to start by saying I love MK, I have been playing for a long time. But as much as I want to love this game I just can't. Beyond the fact that this game is incomplete at launch, Online gameplay is completely broken. most times you desync before the match even starts. I have managed to get two successful fights and i still desynced at the end of one of them. beyond that the game runs worse on PC than it does on PS5 there is a lot of stuttering, it takes forever to load and is capped at 30 fps for cut scenes and fatal blows. I do understand that developing a game can be extremely complicated, however this is completely unacceptable when i am being charged $70 for a game i can barely even play. Honestly if i could go back i would have just kept my money and continued to play MK11 until all of the issues are resolved.

Worst of all is you get kicked from a tower if your internet connection is interrupted. Really? I get kicked from what should be an offline gameplay mode because the game thinks my internet went out? And now I have to do the whole tower over again? I mean Jesus, it's like you want me to uninstall this game. Everything seemed in place for this game to be great and then it just tripped over itself at the finish line. This game is unfinished and you can tell. It's depressing because I know NeatherRealm can do better.

The story is fine, but you can always look up the movie/cutscenes on YouTube. 
Invasions can only be played while connected online and a lot of the BS battles just aren't fun. 
Some characters that were IN THE STORY MODE are locked behind a paywall. 
Exclusive Johnny skin that was for premium edition only is now on the shop for everyone to buy one month into the game. 
Skins are 10 dollars a piece (so is the Shang Tsung announcer VFX). This game isn't free-to-play Fortnite. Many of us spent $100+ on this game. Stop up charging so much on content. 
Multiplayer is a MESS. Unlike SF6, you can't see your opponent's connection or reject the fight if it's bad. You can't view replays, create clubs, or make lobbies. All of that can be done in SF6 too. 
The ranks in multiplayer are a BIG GRIND. It shouldn't be too much of an issue, but 95% of people in the top 3 ranks are abusing the most broken, unskilled characters and kameos: Johnny Cage, Raiden, and Baraka for main charactes while there's Jax and Cyrax for kameos (sometimes Kano for OP Cage setup). It's just the same thing over and over again. They're top tier because they have mix ups and have you constantly guessing where to block - and if you guess wrong for one hit, there goes about 40% of your health. I should also mention there was a Player 1 advantage bug for the first 2-3 weeks where player 2 wouldn't be able to land some combos because gravity differences. 
The game has so much potential and it needs a lot more content and fixes. I'm sure the title was rushed for development.

If you receive the message "An error has caused you to disconnect from the session" when attempting to play Kombat League, make sure your game is installed on a SSD and NOT a hard drive. I had this problem at first. My online record was 1/9 and never even got past a black loading screen for an online match. Turns out the game isn't loading in fast enough and is kicking you before the match starts. Installed it to the SSD and its loading matches perfectly. Just a heads up! Other than that, the game runs flawlessly and the graphics are gorgeous. 10/10

Although it is not nearly as good content-wise like MK11 had with the Krypt and Towers of Time at launch, giving us tons of things to do from the start, Mortal Kombat 1 stands the test of time yet again, making up for it with... story mode. Yea thats about it, Invasions is, cool I guess, but it gets old and repetitive after the second zone. What stands out the most has to be the story this time around, revamping the original story and making way for more to come after. Online is pretty fun, and ranked is as toxic and try-hardy as ever (not like thats an issue though). 

Id give the game a solid 7/10, that is until we get more characters and content.

I don't feel there is enough content to justify the price tag as it stands currently. The new game mode "invasions" is definitely a step down from the previous entry. Where did they draw inspiration from this? Super Mario world? Or the spirits adventure in super smash bro's ultimate adventure mode? I really loved the explore aspect of the krpyt in the previous entry, as someone who primary enjoys the single player experience extensively. Perhaps in time they will make it better. The themes for invasions will cycle out every couple of months or so but I feel it will just be more of the same at the end of the day. An unfulfilling, mindless grind. I really wish they would stop with the gimmicky voice actor choices for these characters just for the sake of popularity. We should have a choice for an alternate Nitara's  voice actress, I am not a fan of Megan Fox voicing an iconic 3D era character and I would actually pay money to have the option. I'm sorry but she does not fit the bill. She fits it about as much as Rhonda Rousey did voicing Sonya Blade in MK11. Rhonda Rousey definitely did a better job though.  Not to mention there were some glitches in the game which they have patched that are completely inexcusable. I don't know where they put the focus here in this release. The character models look as amazing as ever. I just wish the game did them justice.

Let me first say the gameplay of Mortal Kombat 1 is solid and fun. It emulates a lot of what MKX did and I like that. The kameos are a fun addition. While I think the story opens up for a lot more problems in future installments, it's fun enough here and most of the cast sounds great (Megan Fox is an unfortunate exception here). Invasions are different from the Krypt, but fun enough. Graphics are great, music is great; overall, the presentation and base gameplay of MK1 are rock solid, and normally I would recommend this game.

Unfortunately, I cannot say this without mentioning that, in its current state, you must be willing to deal with outright consumer hostility from the leadership responsible for the direction MK1 has taken in regards to progression and online play. 

First of all, progression. This game has four different kinds of currency: Koins (for the Shrine, where you wait 5 seconds for a stupid animation to play before getting a random cosmetic), Seasonal Currency (for the seasonal shop), Dragon Krystals (for PREMIUM cosmetics from the seasonal shop), and the Invasion currency I can't recall the name of that you'll never end up using because talismans are usually not necessary. While I get the idea behind splitting these currencies up for different purposes, I cannot agree with the amounts you gain for performing tasks in the game. 25 seasonal currency for a daily quest? 250 for a weekly? 100 seasonal currency and koins for completing a tower? When skins cost maybe 1000 or 1500 at minimum, with the featured seasonal skins costing 6000 and 4000? 

That grind you're being asked to perform for these skins is present all over MK1. Character and Kameo mastery? A grind. Reaching Elder God online? A grind. It feels as though someone who has only ever worked on F2P mobile games was contracted to help NRS form the progression system for MK1. There's overall less gear to grind for considering they've stripped the number of gear slots from 3 to 1 from MK11, but that's not really a plus. 

So it's grindy. Unfortunately, the online also just feels wrong. I'm no netcode student, but other fighting games just seem to have cleaner connections on the whole. With no background matchmaking and no cross play, it really feels like MK1 online was designed by someone from the early 2000s of fighting game design. Also, sets are best of 5. You can one-and-done, but the amount of LP you gain is usually quite minuscule if you don't finish sets, meaning that the online is (you guessed it) grindier than other titles in the series. 

It's very sad to see a game either get rushed out the door or hamstrung by leadership decisions like this, because there is fun to be had playing MK1. It's just mired in modern gaming crap meant to squeeze every dime and second it can out of you. If you can deal with all of that or just don't mind it, there's a good fighting game here, but keep in mind that the practices behind it are profit driven at your expense.

After playing some more I'm updating this review with some negatives. I mostly played in Local versus mode which is the way I've always liked playing MK the most, I've no interest in online play.

- P2 cannot see any of their finishing moves in the pause menu. No idea why this is done. Its annoying for new players.
- No krypts :(
- Invasion mode is boring and kinda sucks, time spend making it should have been put in additional playable characters available straight from the start.
- Fatal Blows...blow because you can basically always block them (90% of the time its 100% effective!) 
- Cool characters and extras locked behind season pass and special editions. (meh!)
- Hardly any focus on local VS, its all about online and I don't care about online.

+ Gameplay is solid, compared to older MK's there a much bigger focus on getting enemies airborn and then juggle them with some combos. 
+ Graphics look great (Playing on a Ryzen 7, 4070Ti @ 1440p All maxed out)
+ Local 1on1 versus games are still fun.
+ Singleplayer towers, the story mode is nice for some (new) lore

All in all, the positives make it ok to play, but at times all the negatives make it feel mediocre at best. And I really hate that all the cool extra's (characters!) are all locked behind season bundles... Meh!  I don't care about season passes, I just want all the content to be available when I buy a game. It sucks when devs do this and act like season passes are a gift from the Gods... cause they're not, they're a llame way to tie players longer to the game. It sucks and should stop. 
Just give us a good game with full content from the start. Full price games should have full price content.

This game is a large step down from MK11 in most regards.

The single player content is absolutely abysmal, which in turn makes getting better at the game more difficult, because there isn't any fun single player content to practice with

The switch to a live service game was great fro finances, but poor for the player experience. A couple of charters have a meaningful amount of unlocks(Scopion and Johny Cage), and the rest have scraps like they were forgotten about

Most characters have one alternate skin, and most of them are terrible, its the same generic monk cloths for 80% of the cast, until next season when a whapping three characters will get the attention that scopion and Johny cage received.

At this rate, the game will need to be out an entire year before it matches the content of MK11, and imo the online matchmaking isnt as good

The kameo system isnt for me, it allows players that are already masters to have an additional leg up over any regular person who finds these games hard, but likes the satisfaction of slowly getting better

A good player can take 30% combo to a 50% combo with the right use of the kameo system, and i dont think good players needed to shit out an additional 20% damage.

Pros: The gameplay is fantastic. Funnest MK game I've ever played, and I've played all their games in the NRS era. Also, somehow someway, the first few patches the PC version has gotten at the same time (and one even before!) the console versions. Knock on wood, but this might finally be the time MK patches arrive universally across console and PC.
Cons: There are issues with the PC port for a lot of people (typical WB game), so be aware. Fatal blows, menus, cinematics, Invasions are still not 60fps. Loading times are worse than PS5. Visual glitches, especially playing as Reptile. 

Overall: If gameplay is king for you, like it is for me, then you can't miss this. If it isn't, then you might want to hold off until the PC version gets optimized.

" I have given this game ample play time in order to provide this review. Personally I have enjoyed MK since day one, the real MK 1 as it seems. The combos are so extreme if you even miss one input while playing you pretty much will lose all your health after the opponent counters. Easily the worst feeling in any fighting game I have experienced before. This will likely push new players away from playing this game.

The environments and character design are amazing! Sometimes I found myself more impressed with the environments then playing the game. The move sets are visually entertaining! The fatalities and brutalities are on another level. NRS did an amazing job here!

In online match-ups there is constant dropped frames or ending of match-ups randomly. You will be playing and in mid stride the match is dropped. There are also times where things just freeze up and you have to restart the entire game. At the time of this writing there is also no cross-platform available. (To be fair they did mention this would be added later.)

I am very tough on studios like this who have massive finance to build games on this scale. It is 2023 and their are things in games that are a standard now. No cross-platform at launch is a dropped ball, not having hit boxes applying when they should is a dropped ball. The lighting on the characters in the stages...is a dropped ball...These are incredibly easy adjustments in a game to fix...It is multiple weeks and no change...

I cannot recommend this game to players, especially new to the franchise...No way..." ~Salter Dee

I much anticipated the release of this game, and for the most part it has not disappointed. The mechanics are better than MK11, the combos have double the potential, and the story mode looks absolutely beautiful with Unreal Engine 5. To save us both time, let's get straight into pros and cons:
PROS:
- Mechanics: Up block, armored EX attacks, Combo breaker, down1 being punishable, combo potential, Fatal Blow nerfed, dash cancels, air combos, flawless block attacks removed, KB removed
- Customization: Seasonal credits are easily acquirable, especially if you play invasion game mode. Each character has one piece of gear, and one pallet. You play a character, you get progression and rewards for THAT character (Unlike Injustice 2). You cannot customize character intros, but you can pick and choose end of round taunts now. Each character has one signature piece of gear you can customize, and honestly I don't mind it.
- Graphic design: The maps are beautiful, and the transition into a fight is smoother than ever with the clash-like intro. Although there are no environmental interactions (fine by me), certain objects in the background get broken during the fight.
- You can kick Johnny Cage's Roomba during the fight.

CONS:
- Dashes do still feel a tad short, but I am coming from Injustice 2.
- Although my computer is nearly at recommended specs, the game is not running very consistently. 60 FPS most times, and then sometimes the games drops frames or freezes for a moment. The optimizations recommended by the community that you can do via control panel and task manager help a lot, but this game still has some bugs to work out it would seem (Such as the opponents head floating during a classic brutality).
- Certain fighters are earned by playing (Kameos unlock with account levels, but is not hard to get - Havik is unlocked by playing the campaign).
- Graphics setting are oddly laid out. At first I thought there was no detailed settings, but I realized that you have to press another button to see them.
- The story wasn't half bad! I just found the ending a little common nowadays.

In it's current condition, I cannot recommend MK1.  I expect a game series to build upon itself with every new installment and in this respect, MK1 fails miserably.  No Krypt, no background interaction, no Stage Fatalities/Brutalities, no Krushing Blows, limited Kustomization, no Intro dialogue for single player, only one match intro/outro, no Towers of Time-like events. Fatalities and Brutalities have to be unlocked by grinding the Mastery System.  Invasions are very grindy and boring but you are forced to farm them if you want to unlock all the current season's content. It feels so unfinished when compared to its predecessor. The game is exceptionally unbalanced between fighters and Kameos.  Furthermore, the game has no Cross-play and is still very buggy this far after launch.  Prepare for desyncs, lost connections, and game crashes across all modes. Very poor optimization and very little patch support forcing the community to find their own work-arounds.  Most Story Mode costumes are also locked behind a paywall. I had such high hopes for this game after MK11 and paid for the Premium Edition even with its ridiculous markup.  Hold off for a substantial patch/ content update for now; if it ever comes.

Honest review here, and spoiler-free. 

I really enjoy playing playing MK1 at times, but it feels hard for me to fully recommend this game with some major issues still persisting a month after the release. For context, I've been playing fighting games since Marvel vs Capcom 2 on the PS3, and further back if you include Smash Melee. My last Mortal Kombat game that I fully got into was MK9 on PS3. I've played the story of MKX recently. Safe to say, I had positive expectations going into this game. 

Simply put, the issues plaguing the PC port, lackluster optimization, Invasion issues, online and visual bugs, and yes, crashes, are still present, and that saves me from giving this game a fully positive rating.

I enjoyed the story, but the formula for setting up story fights has gotten fatigued at this point. Many times, a character has the ability to kill off an enemy, but chooses not to because of plot armor, and this gets in the way of good storytelling, sadly. There's times where characters just be jogging somewhere and it's unintentionally funny. I liked the finale, but like many have said it feels a bit rushed. 

The game as a whole feels rushed to a point. A month after release and brutality animations are still bugged, and some are near impossible to perform. The PC port is, in general, poorly optimized. I have a PC that can run almost every modern AAA game at high settings with no issues, and yet, this game cannot run at 60FPS unless I lower it to 720p, which is embarrassing. The shrine takes forever just to open a pointless lootbox animation that, most times, never feels rewarding. Most of your rewards are going to be concept art. 

Worse yet, online play feels like a slog sometimes. For some godforsaken reason Ranked battles are locked to 3/5, and you cannot back out if you have won the match, only if you have lost. This is 2023, and we are still dealing with a lackluster online experience with:
-very poor connections with players
-no ability to deny those bad connections
-no ability to host truly private lobbies
-locked casual matches with matchmaking only with those of similar winrate, which defeats the purpose of casual matches in the first place
-no crossplay?!
-crashes upon multiple Kasual Games played in a row (did anyone test this?)

I don't like to make comparisons to other fighting games that have very different flavors and playerbases, but this is not the experience I would have expected from a AAA title at full price.

I do have many positive things to say about the game, however, such as the presentation of many of the characters, variety of color and variety in the maps/arenas, great campy voice acting (other than megan fox, yes, who is not a trained voice actor) and the creativity with movesets, even if combos and fatal blows tend to overstay their welcome in terms of length.
Strangely I also really like that Microphone chat is on by default. It's fun to hear people express themselves when they lose (and sometimes win), even if it's a bit toxic.

To sum things up, I had a friend ask me if he should get MK1, and I told him straight up to play other games until they fix the issues and to try to get the game discounted. And that's what  would recommend to you guys. Just be a patient gamer, and wait. Play things you enjoy playing. This is not a priority release, unless you are a fighting game or MK diehard.

I'd like to preface this by saying I am a huge Mortal Kombat fan. I love this series so much and it hurts all the more seeing NRS releasing such an undercooked title. 
The Good:
-Amazing and satisfying combos. Combined with graphics it feels so clean laying into your opponents
-Roster is the best it's been since MK9 with most of the ninjas and 3D era kharacters making a return
-Stunning graphics
-Timeline reset is a breath of fresh air, seeing former jobber kharacters assume better roles

The BAD:
-TWENTY DOLLAR SKINS in a game that is 70 DOLLARS MINIMUM. It is outrageous that a game this expensive is charging 20 dollars for skins you can't unlock unlike in MK11 where you only paid if you didn't want to grind. Skin packs from MK11 gave THREE skins and they weren't even this expensive.
-Invasions has got to be the worst grind NRS ever made. The battles are tedious, the minigames get old fast, and the rewards you get stink. Did I mention it's the only way to earn xp at a reasonable pace? Basically, if you want the only other skin available for kharacters, you have to grind for hours on end, doing the same battles over and over which leads to my next point.
-Very little content. Like, 2 skins per kharacter, some of them have 3. This isn't because they didn't make any skins, they're just drip feeding them through the seasonal invasions. So basically, until next month's invasions, you'll be seeing a lot of brown and red since that's the theme for this month. Everyone has the same skin because there isn't any more to unlock. The shrine, which has replaced the krypt for a place to spend koins, is a discount gacha system that drops random rewards. It can be completely drained with just over 120,000 koins which can be earned in very little time. Seeing such little content at launch for the most expensive title to date is depressing especially when you look at MK11 which had dozens of skins and gear for each kharacter AT LAUNCH.
-The PC port is TERRIBLE. Even on a high end PC it suffers from random stutters and caps out at 30 fps. This is unacceptable for a 70 dollar game in 2023.
-Essential features from previous titles are just missing. No pinning moves means you need to constantly go to the menu and study a long sheet of specials and combos every time you want to play a new kharacter. Into dialogues can only be seen in single battles against the CPU or online players, they can't be seen in towers at all. There's also no way to change skins or gear quickly in the kharacter selection, only in the menu. 

This game was a massive let down. It's depressing that the new norm for triple A games is to release them unfinished or with a lack of content just to add it later. There is no excuse for this game to have so little content at launch for 70 bucks. If you are a Mortal Kombat fan and are on the fence about buying this game, I'd say wait for a sale or wait for them to add more content. If this is the first Mortal Kombat you've considered buying; don't. Just go play street fighter or some other fighting game that has devs that give a shit. 4/10

Story Wise: Felt rush. First half the story was fine. Second half was a snoozefest. Just Youtube the story because it's pretty nonsensical and cringe. Slight spoiler: I thought this game was going to be a true reboot but it's far from it. It is a sequel and it does the worst offense ever. It makes every event not matter moving forward.

Gameplay Wise: Absolutely. However, customizing your controls honestly suck and it's definitely a game I hard recommend Arcade Stick for. Playing on control is a handicap just because you cannot map multiples of the same button. This comes out because the meter attacks are tricky to time and having to time a command input to a trigger sucks. And remapping block to a button feels rather awkward. But the gameplay is really solid and every hit feels so incredibly impactful. It is a slower pace fighting games on more of the pace of Virtua Fighter then compared to Street Fighter or Tekken. Every input matters a lot and needs prior planning ahead.

This game is not worth its current price to the vast majority of the MK fanbase.

Mortal Kombat has forever been THE casual fighting game, huge playerbase, massive appeal, etc. I find it quite puzzling since the game isn't necessarily easy or "dumbed down" like a lot of japanese FGs are trying to do to bring in the casual crowd, its the average MK experience with some characters requiring quite a bit of execution - Kenshi comes to mind for example - yet even then it wasn't just the mechanics that brought in the casual crowd, it was the single-player content MK was known for. A vast campaign, a somewhat decent plot, some kind of single-player enjoyable content like The Krypt, Test Your Might, the fatalities, the unlockable character customization, and so on.

This entry in the series though while it does live up in expectations for a good fighting game, hell it might even be the best systems MK has ever had, it does not provide quality single-player content to warrant a purchase from the vast majority of the fanbase.

After the grandiose success of SF6 and its reinventing of the FG single-player experience, MK1 simply fails to provide even a smidgeon of content when compared to Capcom's masterpiece, and while it does have deep and engaging systems for players who ARE interested in the "fighting" aspect, the character customization and single-player content has very little enjoyment to be had for the average buyer.

Invasions are a weak replacement for The Krypt, they're incredibly slow and uninteresting to progress through and feel tacked on amidst a game begging for real content. It has a ton of unnecesary fights and really annoying "effects" during the fights that make them incredibly annoying to do. Especially the fucking slow effect, that one sucks.

The multiplayer also has its issues, the ranking system is very barebones and doesn't have a per-character rank so you're always scared of trying new things, the connection to the servers too was very poor during launch, but that has since been fixed. Lobbies have also not returned, which makes the experience of playing against friends inherently frustrating since everyone just has to matchmake each other through the friend list.

Overall the multiplayer aspect of the game is incredibly outdated even when compared to older titles like Skullgirls, Tekken 7 or even MK11!

With all that said tho, I do recommend it. Even with all of these issues I've still been massively enjoying it, I feel like my money was well spent because the GAME part of the game is incredible, I love fighting games and this one is no exception. Maybe I'm biased since MK has never dumbed down its mechanics, but everytime I play it I just have fun. The characters, the kombos, the kameo system, everything related to the FIGHTING aspect is just fantastic. The balancing of characters and assists is the best NRS has ever had (not as good as SF6 but better than NRS's previous titles) and the visuals and animations have greatly improved.

I've never been a fan of MK so this lack of content doesn't affect me in the slightest, all I wanted was a good fighting game and I got it. If however you're looking for single-player "kontent" like in SF6, or even like in previous entries to the series you might be sorely disappointed. I, however, really really like it.
